translated: therefore, for the reasons stated, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases surely exist.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'jug pa shas che ba la brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / de dag gi nyes dmigs kyi skyon bstan pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'jug pa shas che ba la brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / de dag gi nyes dmigs kyi skyon bstan pa /
translated: The faults of the problems of those are taught.

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi @96a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi @96a * //
translated: Those are like an illusion, a mirage, a dream,

original: lam dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu de dag ni tha snyad par yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lam dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu de dag ni tha snyad par yod pa yin gyi /
translated: and a city of gandharvas. They exist conventionally,

original: don dam pa bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa bar ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: de'i phyir de dag nyid brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag nyid brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, those should be analyzed.

original: 'di la khyod chags pa 'dod chags kyi snga rol na'am /
analyzed: 'di la khyod chags pa 'dod chags kyi snga rol na'am /
translated: Here, do you assert that attachment exists prior to one who is attached,

original: phyis sam / 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig na yod pa'am /
analyzed: phyis sam / 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig na yod pa'am /
translated: after one who is attached, simultaneously with attachment and one who is attached,

original: 'dod chags chags pa'i snga rol na'am /🔽phyis sam / 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig na yod par 'dod grang na /
analyzed: 'dod chags chags pa'i snga rol na'am / phyis sam / 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig na yod par 'dod grang na /
translated: prior to attachment and one who is attached,🔽after attachment and one who is attached, or simultaneously with attachment and one who is attached?

original: de la re zhig / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: If one who is attached exists without attachment,

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: then attachment would exist without one who is attached.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa /
translated: If one who is attached exists prior to attachment,🔽then attachment would exist without one who is attached.

original: 'dod chags med pa zhig yod par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa zhig yod par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: “If there were no one who is attached” is supplied to complete the sentence.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs te /
translated: “Attachment,” “one who is attached,” and “one who is very attached” are synonyms.

original: de med cing ma gtogs pa 'dod chags la mi ltos pa zhig yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: de med cing ma gtogs pa 'dod chags la mi ltos pa zhig yod par gyur na'o //
translated: If there were no one who is attached, who is not excluded from attachment, who does not depend on attachment, then attachment would exist.

original: smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that one who is attached does not exist, as it is not tenable that a ripened effect exists without one who is ripened.

original: brtag pa 'di la cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
analyzed: brtag pa 'di la cir 'gyur zhe na / de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
translated: What is the consequence of this analysis?🔽Attachment exists in dependence on one who is attached.

original: chags pa de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chags pa de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Attachment exists in dependence on one who is attached.

original: chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that this is the attachment of this one who is attached.

original: 'o na de lta na 'dod chags med kyang de chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na de lta na 'dod chags med kyang de chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that were so, then one who is attached would exist without attachment.

original: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
translated: Attachment exists in dependence on one who is attached.

original: chags pa yin na de la 'dod chags skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: chags pa yin na de la 'dod chags skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: If it were attached, it would be pointless for attachment to arise in it.🔽Therefore, this is unacceptable.

original: de ltar na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir /🔽skabs kyi don las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa ni chags pa ni 'dod chags med na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir / skabs kyi don las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa ni chags pa ni 'dod chags med na /
translated: Thus, in this case, the meaning of the context is reversed by the word “if.”

original: mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin te /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin te /
translated: The inference is: That which is attached does not arise without attachment,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is dependent, like the intrinsic reality of attachment.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid las /
translated: In the Abhidharma characteristics, it is said:

original: kun 'gro zhes bya rang gi sar //
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes bya rang gi sar //
translated: “The omnipresent is said to be in its own realm.

original: nyon mongs can gyi sngar kun 'gro //
analyzed: nyon mongs can gyi sngar kun 'gro //
translated: The afflicted is omnipresent prior to the path.”

original: zhes 'byung bas chags pa nyid 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas chags pa nyid 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no error because attachment itself is the cause of attachment.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / chags pa yod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: bshad pa / chags pa yod par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if attachment existed,

original: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could attachment exist?

original: 'di ltar ma chags pa la 'dod chags skye ba na chags pa zhes brjod pa'i rkyen la brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma chags pa la 'dod chags skye ba na chags pa zhes brjod pa'i rkyen la brten pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, when desire arises in one who is not attached, he is called “one who is attached” in dependence on the condition.

original: de 'dod chags gang gis chags par gyur pa la chags pa zhes brjod pa de nyid kyis chags par gyur la /
analyzed: de 'dod chags gang gis chags par gyur pa la chags pa zhes brjod pa de nyid kyis chags par gyur la /
translated: But he is not called “one who is attached” by means of that desire by which he becomes one who is attached.🔽Because the arising of desire would be pointless and because there is no inference to prove it.

original: 'dod chags @96b skye ba don med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags @96b skye ba don med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to arise,🔽how could there be one who is attached?

original: gal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa ste /
analyzed: gal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is impossible.

original: chags pa yod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: chags pa yod par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if one who is attached were to exist,

original: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur // zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: how could desire exist?

original: yang na lhas byin chags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la 'dod chags gang skye ba de'i mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na lhas byin chags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la 'dod chags gang skye ba de'i mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Again, when Lhejin is attached, the desire that arises in his continuum is not the direct cause of his being one who is attached.

original: chags pa yin pa'i phyir mchod sbyin chags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chags pa yin pa'i phyir mchod sbyin chags pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is one who is attached, just like Yajña who is attached.

original: gal te de ni mi srid de //
analyzed: gal te de ni mi srid de //
translated: If that is impossible,🔽then how could one who is attached exist?

original: chags pa rgyud tha dad pa dang // tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid phyogs su byed na grub pa la sgrub pa dang / don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chags pa rgyud tha dad pa dang // tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid phyogs su byed na grub pa la sgrub pa dang / don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you make the reason “because of not being a cause of desire in a different continuum,” then it is an established reason, and if you make the reason “because of not being a cause of desire in a non-different continuum,” then it is contradictory.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /🔽chags pa rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid phyogs su byas pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te / chags pa rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid phyogs su byas pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: That is not good,🔽because it is not an established reason, since you make the reason “because of not being a cause of desire in a non-different continuum.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gog pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gog pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not contradictory, because, like the probandum, it refutes the opposite of the probandum by means of the homogeneity of the reason.

original: ci ste mchod sbyin chags pas 'dod chags bsgrub pa nye bar phul bas lhas byin gyi rgyud la 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / byed pa'i rgyus gzhan gyi rgyud kyi chags pa yang gzhan gyi rgyud la 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mchod sbyin chags pas 'dod chags bsgrub pa nye bar phul bas lhas byin gyi rgyud la 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / byed pa'i rgyus gzhan gyi rgyud kyi chags pa yang gzhan gyi rgyud la 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dpe med do zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that the cause of the generation of attachment in Devadatta’s continuum is the offering of the object of attachment by the attached person, and that the cause of the generation of attachment in another’s continuum is the cause of attachment in another’s continuum, then there is no example.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also illogical.

original: rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags sgrub pa me tog dang byug pa la sogs pa dag ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba khyad par can yin pa'i phyir de ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin no //🔽ci ste chags pa'i sngon rol na 'dod chags yod par 'dod na de lta na yang /
analyzed: rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags sgrub pa me tog dang byug pa la sogs pa dag ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba khyad par can yin pa'i phyir de ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba yin no // ci ste chags pa'i sngon rol na 'dod chags yod par 'dod na de lta na yang /
translated: Because it refutes the cause being unshared, and because the cause of the conception of desire is the object of desire, such as flowers and ointments, and because the object to be established is special, that is a fallacious refutation.

original: chags pa la yang 'dod chags ni //
analyzed: chags pa la yang 'dod chags ni //
translated: But if you maintain that attachment exists prior to the attached person, then in that case also,🔽Attachment exists for one who is attached.

original: yod dang med kyang rim par mtshungs //
analyzed: yod dang med kyang rim par mtshungs //
translated: Existence and nonexistence are similar in order.

original: dgag pa'i thabs 'og nas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgag pa'i thabs 'og nas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The method of refutation will be explained later.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa /
translated: That itself is explained:

original: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na //
analyzed: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na //
translated: If prior to attachment

original: chags med 'dod chags yod na ni //
analyzed: chags med 'dod chags yod na ni //
translated: Attachment exists without one attached,

original: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na 'dod chags chags pa med pa zhig yod par gyur na chags pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na 'dod chags chags pa med pa zhig yod par gyur na chags pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If prior to attachment attachment existed without one attached, it would be without one attached.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / de la brten nas chags pa yod //🔽chags pa med pa'i 'dod chags de la brten nas chags pa yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / de la brten nas chags pa yod // chags pa med pa'i 'dod chags de la brten nas chags pa yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Attachment exists in dependence on it.🔽Attachment exists in dependence on that attachment without one attached.

original: 'dod chags 'dis 'dod chags so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //🔽de @97a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'dis 'dod chags so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro // de @97a * //
translated: It would be attachment by this attachment.

original: lta na skyon 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta na skyon 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, this error arises:

original: 'di la chags par byed pas 'dod chags so zhes dngos po sgrub pa yin na dngos po ni gzhi la rag las pa'i phyir gzhi'i sngon rol na med de dper na chos pa 'bras can gyi snga rol na med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di la chags par byed pas 'dod chags so zhes dngos po sgrub pa yin na dngos po ni gzhi la rag las pa'i phyir gzhi'i sngon rol na med de dper na chos pa 'bras can gyi snga rol na med pa bzhin no //
translated: If attachment is established as the thing that is attached, then since a thing depends on a basis, it does not exist prior to the basis, just as a person who possesses a result does not exist prior to the result.

original: chags pa la mi ltos par 'dod chags yod par 'dod na ni ;
analyzed: chags pa la mi ltos par 'dod chags yod par 'dod na ni ;
translated: If you assert that attachment exists without depending on one who is attached,

original: 'dod chags yod na chags yod 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod na chags yod 'gyur //
translated: then one who is attached would exist even without attachment.

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: chos pa nyid la mi ltos par chos pa skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos pa nyid la mi ltos par chos pa skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is untenable that a person who possesses a result exists without the result, so it is untenable that one who is attached exists without attachment.

original: 'dir yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir skabs kyi don las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags ni chags pa med na mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir skabs kyi don las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags ni chags pa med na mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin te /
translated: Here, because this is a statement that allows an opportunity for response, the opposite of the meaning of the context is inferred: Attachment does not occur without one who is attached.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na chags pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na chags pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: It has a mode of being that is dependent, like the self of one who is attached.

original: gal te pha med par yang bu la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te pha med par yang bu la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is not a definitive reason because a son and so on exist even without a father,🔽then we reply:

original: de nyid kyi phyir de yang bkag zin pas de ni mi gnod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de yang bkag zin pas de ni mi gnod do //
translated: Therefore, since that has already been refuted, it does not undermine our refutation.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar 'byung ba'i tshul can chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa nyid chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar 'byung ba'i tshul can chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa nyid chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: “Since you assert that the desire that is the mode of prior occurrence of the moment of attachment is the cause of the desire that is the mode of subsequent occurrence of the moment of attachment, there is no error.”🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if desire existed,

original: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could the desirous one exist?

original: yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
analyzed: yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
translated: It would not exist.

original: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma dus tha dad pa nyid kyis chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma 'byung ba chags pa nyid du byed par mi 'grub pa'i phyir dper na chos pa gzhan gyis gzhan chos pa nyid du mi 'thad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma dus tha dad pa nyid kyis chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma 'byung ba chags pa nyid du byed par mi 'grub pa'i phyir dper na chos pa gzhan gyis gzhan chos pa nyid du mi 'thad pa bzhin te /
translated: Since the moment of attachment that occurs later does not establish the moment of attachment that occurs earlier as the desire that is the mode of prior occurrence of the moment of attachment, it is like this example. It is untenable that one dharma makes another dharma into a dharma.

original: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma 'das pas da ltar chags pa nyid du byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma 'das pas da ltar chags pa nyid du byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
translated: Because it is untenable that the present state of attachment is produced by the past moment of attachment, it is undermined by inference.

original: / ji ltar des gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar des gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it undermined?

original: lhas byin gyi 'dod chags ni lhas byin chags pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi 'dod chags ni lhas byin chags pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Lhejin’s attachment is not the cause of Lhejin’s state of being attached,

original: 'dod chags yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i 'dod chags bzhin no //🔽'dod chags la yang chags pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i 'dod chags bzhin no // 'dod chags la yang chags pa ni //
translated: because it is attachment, like the attachment of someone of a different continuum.🔽Attachment is not🔽The cause of the state of being attached.

original: yod dam med kyang rim par mtshungs //🔽'dir snga phyir rnam par brtag /
analyzed: yod dam med kyang rim par mtshungs // 'dir snga phyir rnam par brtag /
translated: Whether or not attachment exists, the state of being attached is the same.🔽Here, there is no opportunity for dispute

original: pa la klan ka'i skabs med de /
analyzed: pa la klan ka'i skabs med de /
translated: about the order of the earlier and later moments,

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang bar ma bstan pa'i phyir ro /🔽// / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /🔽bam po drug pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang bar ma bstan pa'i phyir ro /🔽// / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /🔽bam po drug pa /
translated: because it has not been shown that the reason is inconclusive.

original: ci ste skyon der na mi rung ngo snyam nas 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis lhan cig nyid du skye bar 'dod na de la yang nyon cig /'dod @97b chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
analyzed: ci ste skyon der na mi rung ngo snyam nas 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis lhan cig nyid du skye bar 'dod na de la yang nyon cig /'dod @97b chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
translated: Do not arise simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brtag pa de la /
analyzed: brtag pa de la /
translated: In that regard,🔽Desire and one who is desirous

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
translated: Would not be mutually dependent.

original: chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o //
translated: One might say, “The desire of this one who is desirous is this.

original: 'dod chags 'dis ni 'di chags par 'gyur ro zhes ltos pa med pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'dis ni 'di chags par 'gyur ro zhes ltos pa med pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: By means of this desire, he is desirous.” But because they are not mutually dependent, that is unacceptable.

original: de gnyis ni ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: de gnyis ni ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: But they are maintained to be mutually dependent.

original: 'dir phyogs kyi chos kyi dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med de /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs kyi chos kyi dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med de /
translated: Here, an inference is made by the power of the property of the position: Desire and one who is desirous do not have the nature of simultaneity.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin no //
translated: Because they are mutually dependent, just like a seed and a sprout.

original: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa ;
analyzed: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa ;
translated: Here the Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: gtan tshigs kyi de gang yin /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi de gang yin /
translated: What is the reason?

original: ci skye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ci skye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Is it because they rely on arising?

original: 'on te brjod pa khyad par can brten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yin /
analyzed: 'on te brjod pa khyad par can brten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yin /
translated: Or is it because they rely on the special expression that supports them?

original: de dag gal te skye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: de dag gal te skye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
translated: If they rely on arising,🔽then minds and mental factors that arise together would be coemergent causes because they are causes of each other.

original: sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / mar me dang / 'on kyang lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / mar me dang / 'on kyang lhan cig tu byung ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: But they are not coemergent causes because they are not similar.

original: gal te brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa la /🔽ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa la / ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If they rely on the special expression that supports them,

original: yang ba lang gi rva lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnyis la yang 'di ni g-yon pa'o //
analyzed: yang ba lang gi rva lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnyis la yang 'di ni g-yon pa'o //
translated: then the two horns of an ox would be coemergent causes because they are supported by the same body.

original: 'di ni g-yas pa'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa mthong bas de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni g-yas pa'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa mthong bas de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is seen that the expression “this is the right one” is used, it is still indeterminate.

original: tshogs pa'i dbang kho na las sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag dang / mar me'i 'od dang bcas pa dag 'byung bas tha snyad du yang lhan cig gi dngos por khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / ba lang gi rva gnyis kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i dbang kho na las sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag dang / mar me'i 'od dang bcas pa dag 'byung bas tha snyad du yang lhan cig gi dngos por khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / ba lang gi rva gnyis kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the mind and mental factors arise and the light of a lamp arises only due to the power of the assembly of causes and conditions, we do not accept that they exist as coexistent things even conventionally, and since the two horns of a cow are not ultimately established,

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
translated: the fault stated does not arise.

original: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag gam /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag gam /
translated: Moreover, here, do you imagine that attachment and one who is attached are the same and coexistent?

original: tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag grang na /🔽de la re zhig gal te gcig pa nyid lhan cig nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag grang na / de la re zhig gal te gcig pa nyid lhan cig nyid du rtog na /
translated: Or do you imagine that they are different and coexistent?🔽First, if you imagine that they are the same and coexistent,

original: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
analyzed: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
translated: then one is not coexistent with itself.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
analyzed: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
translated: It is not itself coexistent with itself.

original: lhan cig nyid ni gnyis la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lhan cig nyid ni gnyis la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that co-existence exists for two things.

original: des na de ni chos mthun pa de'i dpe'i tshig kyang yin no //🔽'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig @98a * //
analyzed: des na de ni chos mthun pa de'i dpe'i tshig kyang yin no // 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig @98a * //
translated: Thus, this is also the example statement for that similarity.

original: tu mi skye ste /
analyzed: tu mi skye ste /
translated: Here, the inference is: Desire does not arise simultaneously with one who is attached,🔽because of being one.

original: gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //🔽gal te slob dpon gyi yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do // gal te slob dpon gyi yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, it is like the intrinsic reality of that desire itself. Thus, it contradicts one's own inference.

original: sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the fault of the proof being incomplete exists because the master's branch is not stated in full,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /🔽slob dpon gyi tshig dag ni don gyi tshig dag yin pa'i phyir dang / don gyi tshig dag gis ni don chen po dag skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te / slob dpon gyi tshig dag ni don gyi tshig dag yin pa'i phyir dang / don gyi tshig dag gis ni don chen po dag skyed par byed de /
translated: that is not good,🔽because the master's words are words of meaning and words of meaning generate great meaning.

original: tshig nyung du nyid yin yang sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig nyung du nyid yin yang sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there are few words, many words of application are established.

original: sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni ma tshang ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni ma tshang ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But in the compound word “co-present,” there would be a deficiency.

original: yang na mi 'gyur te /🔽de la yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa'am /
analyzed: yang na mi 'gyur te / de la yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa'am /
translated: Or, it would not be so,🔽because in that case, it would be well known in the treatises

original: grub pa'i mtha' las cung zad la la la grags pa yin na'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las cung zad la la la grags pa yin na'o //
translated: or in the philosophical literature.

original: ci ste tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that difference itself is co-presence,

original: de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'gal ba med pa'i gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'gal ba med pa'i gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pa'i tshe /
translated: then, when there is no co-presence in the case of a single, non-contradictory thing,

original: ji ste tha dad nyid yin na //
analyzed: ji ste tha dad nyid yin na //
translated: If difference itself

original: lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //🔽tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur // tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: How could there be co-presence?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Co-presence does not exist in the case of difference, because it would be undermined by inference, and because there is no inference that demonstrates the existence of co-presence in the case of difference. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dir yang dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa'o //
translated: Here, the thesis is stated.

original: phyogs kyi chos ni tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pas phyogs brtag pa las tha dad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos ni tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pas phyogs brtag pa las tha dad pa nyid yin te /
translated: Since the property of the position is just difference, and there is no simultaneity, the position is just different from the property of the position.

original: dper na byas pa nyid yin na mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byas pa nyid yin na mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like impermanence, which is just the property of the produced.

original: 'dir smra bar 'dod pa'i don bstan pa'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig nyid med de /
analyzed: 'dir smra bar 'dod pa'i don bstan pa'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig nyid med de /
translated: Here, inference is stated by the power of teaching the meaning that is desired, because in reality attachment and one who is attached are not simultaneous.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are different, for example, like attachment and one free from attachment. Thus, there is the refutation of inference.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te gcig pu lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te gcig pu lhan cig na //
translated: If the one were simultaneous,

original: grogs med par yang de 'gyur ro //🔽'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: grogs med par yang de 'gyur ro // 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: it would be so even without a companion.🔽The context is “attachment and one who is attached are not simultaneous.”

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag grogs med par lhan cig nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag grogs med par lhan cig nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: Attachment and one who is attached are not asserted to be simultaneous without a companion.

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gi lhan cig nyid dgag par bya ba'i chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gi lhan cig nyid dgag par bya ba'i chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang bstan to //
translated: This also shows that the property to be refuted, the simultaneity of desire and the desirous one, is dependent.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid ni lhan cig nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid ni lhan cig nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the inference is: ultimately, desire and the desirous one are not simultaneous because they are dependent,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na @98b 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na @98b 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the intrinsic reality of desire.

original: 'di la gzhan dag ni gal te re zhig 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid yin yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni de lta na grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan dag ni gal te re zhig 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid yin yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni de lta na grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, others say: If desire and the desirous one are simultaneous even though they are not identical, then they would be simultaneous even without a companion.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la gcig ni gcig pu la snyegs te /
analyzed: 'di la gcig ni gcig pu la snyegs te /
translated: Here, one is applied to one.🔽The oneness of one cow and one horse

original: de na ba lang gcig dang / rta gcig ces bya ba'i gcig nyid ni /
analyzed: de na ba lang gcig dang / rta gcig ces bya ba'i gcig nyid ni /
translated: is not the oneness of desire and the desirous one.

original: ba lang la yang snyegs rta la yang snyegs pas gang dang gang na gcig pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
analyzed: ba lang la yang snyegs rta la yang snyegs pas gang dang gang na gcig pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
translated: Since the cow would pursue itself and the horse would pursue itself, then wherever there is oneness, there would be togetherness.

original: ba lang gcig pu nyid dang rta cig pu nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba lang gcig pu nyid dang rta cig pu nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it follows that the cow alone and the horse alone would have togetherness without a companion.

original: de ltar na lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the examination of togetherness would be pointless.

original: kha cig na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: That is not logical,

original: glags yod pa sgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / de dag smra bar 'dod pas de dag nyid brjod par bya ba yin na de dag ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: glags yod pa sgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / de dag smra bar 'dod pas de dag nyid brjod par bya ba yin na de dag ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it is not included among the refutations and proofs of the possible and because if those who wish to speak of togetherness must state those two, they do not state them.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
translated: if different things are together,

original: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: they would be together even without a companion.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: The context is whether attachment and one who is attached are together.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa grogs med par lhan cig nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa grogs med par lhan cig nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: Attachment and one who is attached are not accepted as coexistent without a companion.

original: 'dis kyang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gi lhan cig nyid dgag par bya ba'i chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gi lhan cig nyid dgag par bya ba'i chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang bstan to //
translated: This also shows that the co-existence of attachment and one who is attached is to be refuted, and that they are dependent phenomena.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod par mi 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, the inference is: Ultimately, attachment and one who is attached are not accepted as coexistent when they are different,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bzhin no //
translated: because they are dependent, like cause and effect.

original: 'di la yang gzhan dag ni ji ste yang tha dad pa nyid yin yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang gzhan dag ni ji ste yang tha dad pa nyid yin yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: Here, others say: But if they are different and yet coexistent,

original: de lta na yang grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then even without a companion, they would be coexistent.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽'di la ba lang las kyang rta tha dad la /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'di la ba lang las kyang rta tha dad la /
translated: How so?🔽Here, a horse is different from an ox,

original: rta las kyang ba lang tha dad pas /
analyzed: rta las kyang ba lang tha dad pas /
translated: and an ox is different from a horse.

original: gang dang gang na tha dad pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
analyzed: gang dang gang na tha dad pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
translated: Wherever there is difference, there is co-existence.

original: ba lang tha dad pa nyid dang rta tha dad pa nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba lang tha dad pa nyid dang rta tha dad pa nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it follows that the difference of the cow and the difference of the horse would exist together without a companion.

original: de lta na yang lhan cig nyid du rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang lhan cig nyid du rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: And even so, the conception of co-existence would be pointless.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not right,

original: sngar lan btab pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngar lan btab pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: just like the previous response.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //🔽'dod chags chags pa ci zhig yin //
analyzed: gal te tha dad lhan cig na // 'dod chags chags pa ci zhig yin //
translated: If difference co-exists,

original: lhan cig nyid @99a * //
analyzed: lhan cig nyid @99a * //
translated: what is attachment and the one who is attached?

original: kyis so // de ni de dag la lhan cig nyid med de /
analyzed: kyis so // de ni de dag la lhan cig nyid med de /
translated: By co-existence. But they do not have co-existence,

original: tha dad pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because they are different, like attachment and one free from attachment. The refutation by inference has already been explained.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Moreover:

original: tha dad nyid du 'grub gyur na //
analyzed: tha dad nyid du 'grub gyur na //
translated: If difference is established,

original: tha dad nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Distinctness” means🔽

original: phan tshun mi ltos pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: phan tshun mi ltos pa nyid du'o //
translated: “If they are different” means if they are not mutually dependent.

original: nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thob par ro //
analyzed: nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thob par ro //
translated: “By themselves” means by their own nature.

original: des na des gnyis lhan cig 'gyur //
analyzed: des na des gnyis lhan cig 'gyur //
translated: “Then they would be simultaneous” means that they would be simultaneous by their own nature.

original: khyod kyi blo gros kyis /
analyzed: khyod kyi blo gros kyis /
translated: “Your intellect” means your understanding.

original: gal te 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du 'grub gyur na //🔽de gnyis lhan cig nyid du ni //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du 'grub gyur na // de gnyis lhan cig nyid du ni //
translated: If attachment and one who is attached are established as different,🔽then why do you imagine🔽that they are simultaneous?

original: ci yi phyir na yongs su rtog /'dod chags dang chags pa de gnyis zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na yongs su rtog /'dod chags dang chags pa de gnyis zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: “Those two” refers to attachment and one who is attached.🔽If you say that the purpose of the word “if” is to show that the two are related in the sense that this is the attachment of this one who is attached,

original: ci ste / chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o //🔽'dod chags 'dis ni 'di chags par gyur to zhes ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste / chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o // 'dod chags 'dis ni 'di chags par gyur to zhes ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa yod do zhe na /
translated: and that one who is attached is attached by this attachment,

original: des ni 'dod chags dang / chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa de la zhe 'gras pa'i blos kyang don ma grub pa nyid du brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: des ni 'dod chags dang / chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa de la zhe 'gras pa'i blos kyang don ma grub pa nyid du brtag par mi nus so //
translated: then the reason why attachment and one who is attached are not different is that they are related. Since this has been taught, even one who is hostile cannot deny that the meaning is not established.

original: gzhan yang kho bos /🔽gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bos / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: Moreover, we have said:🔽If prior to desire

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: Desirelessness would exist without desire.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la tha dad pa nyid mi srid par bstan pa dang / khyod kyis 'dod chags dang chags pa dag rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir de gnyis lhan cig la brten to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la tha dad pa nyid mi srid par bstan pa dang / khyod kyis 'dod chags dang chags pa dag rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir de gnyis lhan cig la brten to //
translated: Thus we have shown that it is impossible for desire and one who is desirous to be different, and you have said that in order to establish desire and one who is desirous, they must be mutually dependent.

original: de la yang kho bos /
analyzed: de la yang kho bos /
translated: But we have refuted that with:🔽Desire and one who is desirous

original: 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
translated: Cannot be produced simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag ste /
translated: Thus we have refuted that.

original: lhan cig nyid de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: lhan cig nyid de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi 'dod pas /
translated: Since you do not assert that they are simultaneous because they are mutually dependent,🔽we have refuted that with:

original: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
analyzed: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
translated: One thing is not simultaneous with itself.

original: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
analyzed: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
translated: That itself is not simultaneous with that itself.🔽Since you do not assert that they are different in order to establish that,

original: zhes bya bas gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid bkag pa dang / yang khyod kyis de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du khas ma blangs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid bkag pa dang / yang khyod kyis de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du khas ma blangs pas /
translated: we have refuted that with:

original: tha dad grub par ma gyur pas //
analyzed: tha dad grub par ma gyur pas //
translated: Since they are not established as different,

original: de phyir lhan cig 'dod byed dam //🔽lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de phyir lhan cig 'dod byed dam // lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Do you assert they are coexistent?🔽Or do you assert they are different

original: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
analyzed: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
translated: In order to establish their coexistence?

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When

original: tha dad dngos po ma grub pas //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po ma grub pas //
translated: The thing that is different is not established,

original: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: The thing that is coexistent is not established.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: At that time, Venerable One,

original: tha dad dngos po gang zhig la //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po gang zhig la //
translated: With regard to what thing that is different

original: lhan cig dngos po 'dod par byed //🔽de ji smros shig / ci rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la'am /
analyzed: lhan cig dngos po 'dod par byed // de ji smros shig / ci rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la'am /
translated: Do you assert the thing that is coexistent?🔽How do you say this? Do you assert that the thing that is coexistent is in that which is different that arises sequentially,

original: 'on te @99b lhan cig skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la /🔽lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod par byed /
analyzed: 'on te @99b lhan cig skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la / lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod par byed /
translated: or is it in that which is different that arises simultaneously?

original: de la gal te rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la gal te rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad de /
translated: If you assert that the thing that is coexistent is in that which is different that arises sequentially, that is not tenable.

original: de ni tha dad pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because that is different, like, for example,

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: attachment and one who is free from attachment. This has been explained previously.

original: 'on te lhan cig skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la'o zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that they are different in the sense of being coemergent,

original: de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: then they would be dependent.🔽For example, it is like cause and effect.

original: dper na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: dper na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: This has been explained previously.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin pa grub pa med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin pa grub pa med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since in this way attachment and one who is attached are not established as coemergent or not coemergent,

original: mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: the conclusion is stated:🔽Thus attachment and one who is attached

original: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang // lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang // lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: are not established as coemergent or not coemergent.

original: dpyad pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar te mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dpyad pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar te mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is stated by applying the previous analysis.

original: ji ltar bstan pa'i tshul bzhin du chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par 'grub pa med par nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa'i tshul bzhin du chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par 'grub pa med par nges par bzung ste /
translated: Just as it has been explained, all phenomena are ascertained to be not established as coemergent or not coemergent.

original: 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this, it is said:

original: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
translated: Like attachment, all phenomena

original: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'gyur //
translated: are not coemergent or not noncoemergent.

original: 'dod chags bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par 'grub pa med do //
translated: Just as with attachment, so also with hatred, delusion, and so on, and all outer and inner things, there is no establishment of simultaneity or non- simultaneity.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pas pha rol po dag gis rab tu byed pa'i dang por de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pas pha rol po dag gis rab tu byed pa'i dang por de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma
translated: Therefore, since attachment and so on are not established ultimately in this way, the reason stated by the opponent in the first chapter, “in dependence on them, defilement and the faults are taught,” is not established.

original: grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of that reason is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu 'dir gtan tshigs nyid brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'dir gtan tshigs nyid brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: If a reason is stated here in terms of the conventional, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is that by stating the faults of the reason stated by the opponent, attachment, one attached, and so on are shown to be essenceless.

original: de'i phyir 'jam dpal 'dod chags med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam dpal 'dod chags med do //
translated: Therefore, O Mañjuśrī, there is no attachment.

original: 'dod chags su gdags pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags su gdags pa med do //
translated: There is no attachment to be designated.

original: zhe sdang med do //
analyzed: zhe sdang med do //
translated: There is no aversion.

original: zhe sdang du gdags pa med do //🔽gti mug med do //
analyzed: zhe sdang du gdags pa med do // gti mug med do //
translated: There is no aversion to be designated.🔽There is no delusion.

original: gti mug tu gdags pa med do //🔽'dod chags ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: gti mug tu gdags pa med do // 'dod chags ni byang chub bo //
translated: There is no delusion to be designated.🔽Attachment is awakening.

original: zhe sdang ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni byang chub bo //
translated: Aversion is awakening.

original: gti mug ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: gti mug ni byang chub bo //
translated: Delusion is awakening.

original: ji ltar yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one engaged in the correct way?

original: gang gi tshe na 'dod chags zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na 'dod chags zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs /
translated: When one is not engaged in order to exhaust attachment,

original: zhe sdang zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs /🔽gti mug zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs pa de'i tshe na yang dag par @100a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs / gti mug zad par bya ba'i phyir ma zhugs pa de'i tshe na yang dag par @100a * //
translated: not engaged in order to exhaust aversion,

original: zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhugs pa yin no //
translated: and not engaged in order to exhaust delusion, at that time one is engaged in the correct way.

original: 'das pa'i sems ni chags par mi byed /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems ni chags par mi byed /
translated: One does not cause attachment in the past mind.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang chags par mi byed de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang chags par mi byed de /
translated: One does not cause attachment in the future mind either,

original: 'das zin pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das zin pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already passed and because it has not yet come.

original: da ltar gyi sems kyang chags par mi byed de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sems kyang chags par mi byed de /
translated: One does not cause attachment in the present mind either,

original: da ltar ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
analyzed: da ltar ni gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
translated: because it does not endure at present.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang 'dod chags kyi chos can nam /
translated: And similarly, Subhūti, form is not a thing that has passion or is without passion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are not things that have passion or are without passion.

original: gzugs 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzugs 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa /
translated: The suchness of form that is not a thing that has passion or is without passion,

original: gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: that is the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'dod chags kyi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not aversion, nor is it the absence of aversion.

original: gzugs ni zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
analyzed: gzugs ni zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
translated: The reality of form is not delusion, nor is it the absence of delusion.🔽The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not delusion, nor is it the absence of delusion.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: The reality of form is not bondage, nor is it freedom.🔽The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not bondage, nor is it freedom.🔽The reality of form is not the conditioned, nor is it the unconditioned.🔽The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not the conditioned, nor is it the unconditioned.🔽The reality of form is not the past, nor is it the future or the present.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang zhe sdang gi chos can nam /
translated: The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not the past, nor is it the future or the present.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: The reality of form is not the internal, nor is it the external.🔽The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not the internal, nor is it the external.🔽The reality of form is not the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, or explored by the mind.🔽The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, or explored by the mind.🔽The reality of form is not the past, nor is it the future or the present.🔽The reality of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not the past, nor is it the future or the present.

original: gzugs zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The reality of form is

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang zhe sdang gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and they are not phenomena free from anger.

original: gzugs ni gti mug gi chos can nam /
analyzed: gzugs ni gti mug gi chos can nam /
translated: Form is not the real nature of anger,

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: and it is not the real nature free from anger.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gti mug gi chos can nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gti mug gi chos can nam /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the real nature of anger,

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: and they are not the real nature free from anger.🔽Form is not the real nature of anger,🔽and it is not the real nature free from anger.

original: gzugs ni gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma @100b yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gti mug gi chos nyid ma yin pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i chos nyid ma @100b yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, nor is it the reality of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, nor is it the reality free from the reality of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: gzugs ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: form is not defiled

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: nor is it purified.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not defiled

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: nor are they purified.

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not form, nor is it the reality of form, nor is it the reality free from the reality of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: The feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that are not afflicted and that are not purified are the perfection of wisdom.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /🔽dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /🔽'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las / 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The master Bhāviveka composed this.

original: rab tu byed pa drug pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa drug pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixth chapter of the Root Verses on the Middle Way, called “The Examination of Desire and the One Who Desires.”

original: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in order to teach that the aggregates and so on are essenceless, the seventh chapter is begun by way of refuting the specific objections to emptiness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In reality, one should apprehend that conditioned things, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, definitely have the nature of conditioned things.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are endowed with the characteristics of conditioned things, such as arising.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par mi bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par mi bzung ste /
translated: Here, one should not apprehend that which does not exist as endowed with the characteristics of conditioned things.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: phung po la sogs pa dag la ni skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag la ni skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: But arising, etc., the characteristics of conditioned things, exist in the aggregates, etc. Therefore,

original: gtan tshigs kyi mthu ji skad smos pas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mthu ji skad smos pas /
translated: by the power of the reason as stated,

original: blo gros kyi 'du byed bskyed pa dag ni 'dus byas kyi phung po la sogs pa dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar smra'o //
analyzed: blo gros kyi 'du byed bskyed pa dag ni 'dus byas kyi phung po la sogs pa dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar smra'o //
translated: those whose minds are generated by the formative forces say that the conditioned aggregates, etc., definitely have the nature of conditioned things.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'di la khyed skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid du 'dod pa de dag ci 'dus byas dag yin nam ;🔽'on te 'dus ma byas dag yin /
analyzed: 'di la khyed skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid du 'dod pa de dag ci 'dus byas dag yin nam ; 'on te 'dus ma byas dag yin /
translated: Here, you assert that arising and so on are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena. Are they conditioned phenomena or are they unconditioned phenomena?

original: gal te de dag 'dus byas dag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag 'dus byas dag yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are conditioned phenomena,

original: de la re zhig skye ba'i dbang du byas te bshad pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig skye ba'i dbang du byas te bshad pa /
translated: then first, from the perspective of arising, it is said:

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising is conditioned,

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //🔽mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur // mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: then it would possess three characteristics.🔽Possessing three characteristics

original: mtshan nyid gsum po dag tshogs par 'grub @101a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum po dag tshogs par 'grub @101a * //
translated: means that the three characteristics would be established as a collection,

original: pa ste / chad pa gsum dang ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa ste / chad pa gsum dang ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: like possessing three limbs.

original: de'i phyir don dam par skye ba la sogs pa la /🔽'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par skye ba la sogs pa la / 'dus byas nyid ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, arising and so on

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bzhin no //
translated: are not asserted to be conditioned phenomena, because they are conditioned phenomena, like, for example, the basis of the characteristics.

original: gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not definite because the basis of the characteristic is the characteristic that reveals another basis of the characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan la /
translated: then the basis of the characteristic is not the characteristic that reveals another basis of the characteristic,

original: 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not the characteristic that reveals the conditioned nature of another basis of the characteristic.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no counterexample, it is not indefinite.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas nyid yin du zin na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas nyid yin du zin na /
translated: If arising, etc., were the conditioned nature,

original: yang skyed par byed pa dang / gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang skyed par byed pa dang / gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then they would be the characteristics of the conditioned because they generate, maintain, and destroy.

original: de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad do //🔽skye ba ni skye ba yin la gnas pa ni gnas pa yin /
analyzed: de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad do // skye ba ni skye ba yin la gnas pa ni gnas pa yin /
translated: That is mere assertion, because there is no concomitance.🔽Arising is arising, maintenance is maintenance, and destruction is destruction.

original: 'jig pa ni 'jig pa yin pa las skye ba la sogs pa dag gi bya ba nyid la skur pa btab ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'jig pa yin pa las skye ba la sogs pa dag gi bya ba nyid la skur pa btab ste /
translated: You deny that arising, etc., are the activities of arising, etc.

original: de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽tha snyad du yang byed pa po nyid yin na skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // tha snyad du yang byed pa po nyid yin na skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because they are accepted as the agent of those.

original: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If they were the agent even conventionally, arising would not be a characteristic of the produced because it is the producer.

original: dper na / pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du gnas pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na / pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no // de bzhin du gnas pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: For example, a father is not the characteristic of a son.

original: gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na /🔽zas lus gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na / zas lus gnas par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, endurance would not be a characteristic of the produced because it is the endurer.

original: lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin nam /🔽bran mo bum pa thogs pa bum pa 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin nam / bran mo bum pa thogs pa bum pa 'jog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, food is not the characteristic of the body because it causes the body to endure.

original: bum pa'i mtshan ma yin pa bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i mtshan ma yin pa bzhin no // de bzhin du 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Or for example, a slave woman who holds a pot is not the characteristic of the pot because she causes the pot to be held.🔽Similarly, destruction would not be a characteristic of the produced because it is the destroyer.

original: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: For example,

original: tho ba 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tho ba 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the destroyer of the hammer, arising is not the characteristic of the hammer.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since arising, etc. are not established as the characteristics of the conditioned,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid mngon 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid mngon 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: the meaning of the reason is not established and is clearly contradictory.

original: de lta bas na ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas skye ba 'dus byas yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji skad smos pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas skye ba 'dus byas yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, one who wishes to completely avoid the faults stated should not understand that arising is conditioned.

original: de ltar re zhig skye ba 'dus byas yin na 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i skyon bstan zin to //
